abstract: Bill Cunningham shares photos of men and women wearing wide-brimmed hats on windy day in New York City.
lead_paragraph: The new style of floppy, wide-brimmed felt hats is a problem in the windy streets, especially on 23rd Street and Fifth Avenue, a corner that’s said to have been known in the 1920s as “23 Skidoo.”

headline.main: Bill Cunningham | The Gales of March

snippet: The new style of floppy, wide-brimmed felt hats is a problem in the windy streets, especially on 23rd Street and Fifth Avenue, a corner that’s said to have been known in the 1920s as “23 Skidoo.”
